intro: Verbesina tetraptera, commonly known as the four-winged beggar-ticks, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Central America. It is a herbaceous annual that produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The plant's distinctive feature is its four-winged seeds, which are adapted for wind dispersal. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in open fields, roadsides, and along riverbanks. Botanically, it belongs to the family Asteraceae, also known as the sunflower family.
